paragraphs.text:
%sh

cd data && wget https://github.com/daniel-acuna/python_data_science_intro/blob/master/data/imdb_reviews_preprocessed.parquet.zip?raw=true -O imdb_reviews_preprocessed.parquet.zip && unzip imdb_reviews_preprocessed.parquet.zip && rm imdb_reviews_preprocessed.parquet.zip

%sh
cd data && wget https://github.com/daniel-acuna/python_data_science_intro/blob/master/data/sentiments.parquet.zip?raw=true -O sentiments.parquet.zip && unzip sentiments.parquet.zip && rm sentiments.parquet.zip

cd data && wget https://github.com/daniel-acuna/python_data_science_intro/blob/master/data/tweets.parquet.zip?raw=true -O tweets.parquet.zip && unzip tweets.parquet.zip && rm tweets.parquet.zip

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

import pyspark.sql.functions as fn


#load sentiment analysis sample
sentiment_df = spark.read.parquet('data/sentiments.parquet')
sentiment_df.cache()
sentiment_df.printSchema()

msg.data:
root
 |-- word: string (nullable = true)
 |-- sentiment: long (nullable = true)

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
#sample of positive words
sentiment_df.where(sentiment_df['sentiment'] > 0).show(10)

#sample of negative words
sentiment_df.where(sentiment_df['sentiment'] < 0).show(10)

msg.data:
+-------------+---------+
|         word|sentiment|
+-------------+---------+
|   gratefully|        1|
|gratification|        1|
|    gratified|        1|
|    gratifies|        1|
|      gratify|        1|
|   gratifying|        1|
| gratifyingly|        1|
|    gratitude|        1|
|        great|        1|
|     greatest|        1|
+-------------+---------+

|       word|sentiment|

|    2-faced|       -1|

|   abnormal|       -1|
|    abolish|       -1|

|  abominate|       -1|
|abomination|       -1|
|      abort|       -1|
|    aborted|       -1|
+-----------+---------+
only showing top 10 rows

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
#apply our sentiment analysis on dataset of imdb

from pyspark.ml.feature import RegexTokenizer
imdb_df = spark.read.parquet('data/imdb_reviews_preprocessed.parquet')
#imdb_df.head()
tokenizer = RegexTokenizer(gaps=False, pattern='\\p{L}+', inputCol='review', outputCol='words')
tokenizer_df = tokenizer.transform(imdb_df)
tokenizer_df.show(5)

%spark.pyspark
#now we want to JOIN our tokenized data with the words from Twitter sentiment analysis. To do that we need to 'pivot' our words column, this means for every word inside thos column we will transpose all columns.
tokenizer_df.select('id',fn.explode('words').alias('word')).show(10)

msg.data:
+---------+-------------+
|       id|         word|
+---------+-------------+
|pos_10006|           in|
|pos_10006|         this|
|pos_10006|   critically|
|pos_10006|    acclaimed|
|pos_10006|psychological|
|pos_10006|     thriller|
|pos_10006|        based|
|pos_10006|           on|
|pos_10006|         true|
|pos_10006|       events|
+---------+-------------+
only showing top 10 rows

paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
#now we have de sentiments for every word. With this information, without any ML algorithm, we can compute if an review is positive or negative. To do this we will use the AVERAGE.
#AVERAGE is a value obtained by dividing the sum of several quantities by their number.

sentiment_analisissentiment_analisis = words_imdb_with_sentiment.groupBy(fn.column('id')).agg(fn.avg('sentiment').alias('average_sentiment')).withColumn('sentiment', fn.when(fn.col('average_sentiment') > 0, 1).otherwise(0))
sentiment_analisis.show(10)

%spark.pyspark
#now, let's compute the accuracy of our 'model'.
print("\n\n\nTokenized imdb schema")
tokenizer_df.printSchema()

print("\n\n\nFinal analisis schema")
sentiment_analisis.printSchema()

print("\n\n\n(no)model accuracy")
tokenizer_df.join(sentiment_analisis, 'id')\
    .select(fn.expr('float(score=sentiment)').alias('average')).select(fn.avg('average')).show()

msg.data:
Tokenized imdb schema
root
 |-- id: string (nullable = true)
 |-- review: string (nullable = true)
 |-- score: double (nullable = true)
 |-- words: array (nullable = true)
 |    |-- element: string (containsNull = true)




Final analisis schema
root
 |-- id: string (nullable = true)
 |-- average_sentiment: double (nullable = true)
 |-- sentiment: integer (nullable = false)



\n(no)model accuracy
+-----------------+
|     avg(average)|
+-----------------+
|0.732231471106131|
+-----------------+
